Little known fact #2 - The island used to be inhabited. Dr. Vinderman, the kind-hearted, super-genius, mega-oligarch who runs the world, who organizes the Battle Royales as a means of luring the infamous Storm to the island so that it doesn't consume the world, knows what happened to the inhabitants of the island, and has assured the contestants they don't want to know what happened to them.

1353322222112.content:
"SHIT!" Volley Girl shouted, running away. Jonesy, surprised she didn't shoot back, ran after her, intent on getting his second elimination of the match. She tried to head down the stairs, but Jonesy dug through the floor with his pickaxe, landing in front of her. Yelping, she ran back upstairs, heading into the room and quickly pulling out her build tool, throwing up a stone wall.

"Nowhere to go, Volley Girl," Jonesy said, amused.

"Come oooooon, this isn't fair! There were, like, no guns on the lower level! One of those stupid lizard ninjas got here before me, AND HE DIDN'T EVEN GET OUT OF THE BUILDING BEFORE HE GOT SNIPED!" Volley Girl complained. "Friggin Scoundrel grabbed all his loot before I could! All I've got are Boogie Bombs and ammo!"

Jonesy paused. He quickly glanced around, listening for the telltale electrical aura of one of the Hybrids, just in case there was another around. Sensing no sign of them, he turned his attention back to Volley Girl.

"I haven't gotten a single elimination in my last five games! C'mon, Jonesy, have a heart!" Volley Girl pleaded.

"The battles are just as much about luck as they are skill," Jonesy said. "I was literally seconds ahead of Mutinions Major getting a gun before me."

A wild idea occurred to Volley Girl. "Hey... um... If you give me that SMG, I promise I won't turn on you! We can team up, survive to the end!" she offered.

"And I'm supposed to believe that?" Jonesy said, moving his body out of line of sight of the window.

Volley Girl bit her lip, thinking about something... and decided to go for it. Hey, he's hot, so if nothing else, she thought, if he goes for it I'll get to be with a stud. "Maybe... Maybe I can make it worth your while," she said, her voice going soft and teasing.

Jonesy quirked an eyebrow. "...Explain."

She pulled out her build tool and edited a window into her wall, the stone reshaping itself. Grinning sultrily, she sat on the window, pulling up her skirt and pulling down her shorts to reveal her shapely, black panty clad rump. "C'mon, handsome," she teased. "You know you want this. Wanna go for a Love-Love game, sport?"

Jonesy's eyes widened, a grin coming over his face. He bit his lip and looked around, wondering if he could get away with it. The avatars the players used to interact on the island could summon up a map of the Storm's current position. Jonesy did so, and saw that they were well within the first ring of the Storm. He did have the time... and Volley Girl did have a nice ass...

But he could still hear gunfire outside. And the distinctive sound of a grenade launcher...

135332222323311.content:
Though technically this land was exactly what she was hoping for, a 'land beyond dreams and everything' Princess Rosella was starting to become rather annoyed with it. But what could she have expected when her first moments were her being turned into a troll? Thankfully she had been able to turn back into a human, but still not a good impression. Right now, all she wanted to do was find her mother and get out of this crazy place.

The princess walked along the foggy roads of Ooga-Booga land, already becoming lost. "Oh dear, I hope this fog lifts soon enough. I don't want to triiiiaiiii!" Having continued walking despite the low visibility, Rosella found herself tripping head-first into a large marsh. Currents pulled on her body, taking her away from the shore as a strange laughing echoed through the fog.

The male voice spoke out into the fog. "Welcome dearie, to the Marsh of Depravity." Rosella tried to rub the sludge out of her eyes, only succeeding in bringing more to her face. "My, what a beautiful little thing you are. I can't wait to see what the Marsh will do to you."

Rosella felt a powerful tingle spread across her body, though paid it little mind as the Marsh pulled her away from Ooga-Booga Land. "Who are you? And what kind of name for a marsh is that?" If Rosella was paying more attention to herself, she would have seen her form was shrinking, her ears were beginning to lengthen and her nose puff up.

"It's exactly what the name implies. All who enter the Marsh of Depravity become broken being, turned into the object of their desires with all sense drained except more the most self serving ones." As the male voice chuckled, a slimy hand pulled it's way out of the Marsh. A creature made entirely of the mud of the Marsh rose in front of Rosella. If it had been a true creature, it would have been a rather large, fat snake/human hybrid, with it's phallus larger than anything she could have seen. "And from the looks of you, the swamp is already taking effect. I've never seen a more beautiful troll."

"Troll...?" Rosella's world stopped, she prayed that the snake was joking, but a look down into the oddly reflective mud showed the muddy creature wasn't lying. Staring back at her was the face of her troll form. "No...not again. I can't be a troll! Not again!"

"Well of course you can dearie, it must clearly show a love for the form that the swamp would turn you into it. And I bet you feel so nice." Rosella wanted to rebut the mud snake creature's words to high heaven, there was no way she could be proud to once again be a short ugly little troll. And yet, she couldn't deny there was a strange kind of beauty in her form. She just continued to stare at her reflection, not realizing the creature was closing in on her. "Yes...you look so beautiful like this. In fact...."
